content: Stephen Kissler | Computer Science | University of Colorado Boulder Skip to main content Computer ScienceHomeAcademicsResearchPeopleNews & EventsAdmissionsInclusionTranslateEnglishSpanishChineseFrenchGermanKoreanLaoNepaliJapaneseTibetanSearchEnter the terms you wish to search for.This siteAll of Colorado.eduOther ways to search:Events CalendarCampus MapStudentsEngage with UsFaculty/Staff ResourcesAboutAdmissionsContact UsJobsFunding OpportunitiesMS-CS + MS-AI Required Notification and SARAAccreditationStrategic VisionStephen KisslerAssistant ProfessorLab websiteStephen Kissler is an assistant professor of Computer Science. He studies epidemiology, pathogen evolution, and complex social systems. Stephen received his BS and MS degrees in Applied Mathematics at the University of Colorado Boulder and then earned his PhD from the University of Cambridge as a Gates Scholar. He worked for three years as a postdoctoral fellow at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health before joining the faculty at CU Boulder.
